key_insight: LongFly integrates long-horizon spatiotemporal context into UAV vision-and-language navigation so the agent can maintain stable semantic alignment and make robust path decisions across rapidly changing viewpoints and dynamic scenes.
problem_solved: Tackles the challenge of modeling long-horizon spatiotemporal context for UAV VLN in high-information, dynamic environments (e.g., post-disaster search and rescue), where existing methods fail to align language with visual observations and produce unstable long-range plans.
method: Spatiotemporal context integration: fuse multi-view visual observations over time into a persistent scene representation to support long-horizon reasoning.
Temporal-aware language–vision alignment: apply memory/attention mechanisms to ground instructions across changing viewpoints and time steps.
Hierarchical planning: use the integrated spatiotemporal representation to inform stable, long-horizon navigation decisions and trajectory generation.
impact: Enables more reliable, interpretable UAV navigation in long missions and dynamic real-world scenarios, improving applicability of VLN systems for search-and-rescue and other field robotics tasks. Practitioners can adopt its spatiotemporal integration ideas to enhance multi-modal grounding and planning in other long-horizon agents.

paper_title: LongFly: Long-Horizon UAV Vision-and-Language Navigation with Spatiotemporal Context Integration
paper_authors: Wen Jiang, Li Wang, Kangyao Huang, Wei Fan, Jinyuan Liu
